speaker: EXCAVATOR
line: Here, try the screen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Concentrate on this area, over here. Right there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... What's going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure I can explain, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You called for a forensic excavation at five A.M. on a Sunday? What are you looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just give me a minute, Scully, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you doing out here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I keep having this dream. It's about a little blond girl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying that you're out here because of something you saw in a dream?

speaker: EXCAVATOR
line: Sir!

speaker: EXCAVATOR
line: Carefully remove the dirt around it...

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, tell me about this dream.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've had... flashes of it, three nights in a row. And last night, it went on long enough to lead me right to her. I need the chest exposed.

speaker: EXCAVATOR
line: Yes, sir. It just takes a little time. Sir, let us do that... sir...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if you destroy evidence, we may never find out what happened here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know what happened here. She was strangled. He used an eight-gauge electrical cord. He took something from the body post-mortem... a trophy. A piece of fabric cut from her clothes... in the shape of a heart.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying you got all these details from your dream?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I know this M.O. I know it from memory.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whose M.O.?

speaker: MULDER
line: John Lee Roche. He killed thirteen eight-to-ten year-old girls. This makes fourteen.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was a difficult case, he was extremely hard to catch. By 1990, ten victims had been found scattered across the eastern seaboard. The earliest dated back to 1979. V.I.C.A.P. named the case "paper hearts" because of the trophies the killer took. All the victims were abducted from their homes. Reggie Purdue brought me onto the case because he thought I could get inside the killer's head.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I concluded that, that we were probably looking for a salesman. Someone who, who traveled around a lot, someone who could gain people's confidence, someone ordinary. Turns out Roche was a vacuum cleaner salesman. His job took him all over the northeast. He'd be in someone's home, demonstrating his vacuum cleaner. All the while, he'd be checking out their kids. He'd choose a victim then come back for her months later.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But it was your profile that caught him. What about the, uh, the trophies he took, the cloth hearts?

speaker: MULDER
line: We never found them, but we didn't need them to make the case. We had him cold on thirteen counts of murder. He admitted to thirteen. Polygraph said he was telling the truth. But that always bugged me about this case. I always wanted to find those hearts and count them, see if they really added up to thirteen. I guess they didn't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if nothing else... I think I can at least help explain your dream. I don't think you ever stopped thinking about this case. I believe that you may have solved it in your sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you think that I've somehow had this information about a fourteenth victim all the time and I've been processing it unconsciously?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said it yourself once. You said that a... a dream is an answer to a question we haven't learned how to ask. You did good work, Mulder. Let's identify this girl so we can put her to rest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I believe her name is Addie Sparks. She went missing from her home in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, in June of 1975. I contacted the Center For Missing and Exploited Children, ran a search through the database.

speaker: MULDER
line: 1975 is too early.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The match is right, Mulder. The, the, the height is right, the description of the sleeper is right.

speaker: MULDER
line: That would mean Roche started way before we thought he did.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we're going to have to verify this. Are you up for that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Frank Sparks?

speaker: FRANK SPARKS
line: Can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I'm Agent Scully, this is Agent Mulder. We're with the Federal Bureau of Investigation. May we speak with you?

speaker: FRANK SPARKS
line: You found Addie? This was for the tooth fairy. When Addie was asleep at night, I'd... I'd come and put a quarter in this pocket. Her mother sewed it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is your wife, sir?

speaker: FRANK SPARKS
line: She passed away last summer. So, you, you, uh... you're saying the, uh... the man that did this is already in prison.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, sir, and he won't get out.

speaker: FRANK SPARKS
line: You do this full-time, telling people... this kind of news?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir, not full-time.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not a good job.

speaker: FRANK SPARKS
line: No. I used to think... that missing was worse than dead because... You never knew what happened. Now that I know... I'm glad my wife's not here. She got luckier. How many more people, uh... like me are you going to visit today?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir?

speaker: FRANK SPARKS
line: Were there other victims... you didn't know about?

speaker: MULDER
line: Roche's car... Roche drove a white El Camino, Scully. I saw it in my dream.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you saying that means?

speaker: MULDER
line: The cloth hearts he collected, he would have wanted to keep them close to him. For a traveling salesman, that means inside the car, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe... you're saying the hearts might still be in his car?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he doesn't have them in prison, the cell is searched regularly, his mail is examined. His car was sold at auction in 1992, put beyond his reach. It's worth a look, Scully. We've got to find those hearts in order to count them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't you think the car might have been searched at least once already?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not by me.

speaker: MAN
line: Here it is. I've been, you know, detailing it. Dropped the bed shell and did the decals, stuff like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: MAN
line: Honest-to-God, serial killer owned my car? For real?

speaker: MULDER
line: Helping him detail. Something's wrong here, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe it's underneath.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Mad Hat..." Hey, Scully. The camper shell. The kid said he took the camper shell off. "Mad Hat." Mad Hatter.

speaker: MULDER
line: Eight... nine, ten... eleven, twelve... thirteen, fourteen...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Addie Sparks. Fifteen... sixteen.

speaker: MULDER
line: He had two more victims.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Mulder. Long time, no see. You got a new partner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: So what's up?

speaker: MULDER
line: We found Addie Sparks, John.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Congratulations, I guess.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We also found your cloth hearts. All sixteen of them.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Huh.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sixteen victims, John. How come you only said there were only thirteen?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I don't know. Thirteen sounds more magical, you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you tell us about your last two victims, then?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're in here for life, you've got nothing to lose.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I got nothing to gain.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can gain one moment of decency in your life. You can finally let those families put their daughters to rest.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I understand you take this very personally, Mulder. How about this? Sink one from there and I'll tell you. You'd trust a child molester? You bring my hearts and give them back to me... I'll tell you everything you want to know. Let me out.

speaker: MAN
line: ...she had erased a conversation between President Nixon and H.R. Haldeman while transcribing the subpoenaed tape. Woods testified that she had erased only about five minutes of the conversation but the tape contained an eighteen-minute gap.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Fox, it's your move.

speaker: MAN ON TV #1
line: Under investigation from Senator Howard Baker, H.R. Haldeman reiterated the White House explanation that Rosemary Woods mistakenly erased...

speaker: MULDER
line: Samantha...

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Are you going to move or not?

speaker: MAN ON TV #1
line: ...foot on the footpedal...

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Do we have to watch this, Fox?

speaker: MAN ON TV #1
line: ...and then accidentally hitting the record button.

speaker: LEON JAWORSKI ON TV
line: It must be very difficult to reach a conclusion. It was an accident.

speaker: MULDER
line: "The Magician" comes on at nine.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Mom and Dad said I could watch the movie, buttmunch.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're next door at the Galbrands'. They left me in charge. No. Not again. Samantha, run!

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Fox! Fox!

speaker: MULDER
line: Samantha!

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Did you bring me my hearts?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yesterday, you said something about me taking it personally. Why did you say that to me? Where were you in 1973?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: What, the whole year?

speaker: MULDER
line: November. Twenty-seventh of November. Do you know what I'm getting at?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I was selling vacuum cleaners in 1973. I made a sales trip to Martha's Vineyard that year and... I sold a vacuum cleaner to your dad. He bought it for your mom. I believe it was a, um... Electrovac Duchess or the Princess model and... your dad and I talked about it at great length. He... he had a really hard time choosing.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you know about my sister?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You bring me my hearts... and maybe I'll tell you more. This man... this man hit me.

speaker: GUARD
line: I didn't see it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I did.

speaker: MULDER
line: He was there, Scully. He was in the house. He took Samantha.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In your dream, Mulder. It was a dream. Your mind made it up.

speaker: MULDER
line: A dream is an answer to a question we haven't yet figured out how to ask, right? Something buried in your subconsciousness. You heard him in there, he knew something. He mentioned being on Martha's Vineyard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it a state secret you lived in Martha's Vineyard?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, how would he find out about that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Through the prison library. The inmates have access to computers and the internet. I checked. Roche logged on just yesterday.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looking for what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The server records don't show, but on the Net, Mulder, he can find out practically anything about you. Look, he is playing with you, Mulder. He is committing emotional blackmail and you are letting him. You walked into that room with your heart on your sleeve. He saw vulnerability, and he took advantage of it. You had a dream... a nightmare... and you, and you had it because of all the emotions that this case is stirring up for you. But... it was nothing but a dream.

speaker: MULDER
line: My last dream came true. Scully, do you believe that my sister Samantha was abducted by aliens? Have you ever believed that? No. So what do you think happened to her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you saying you believe now?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. I don't know what happened. I don't know what to believe. I just know that I have to find out now.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom, I'm in the basement. I'm sorry, how are you feeling?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Good, Fox, I'm fine. Honey, what are you doing down here in the middle of the night?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you recognize... these fabrics? Either one of them?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: What am I looking at?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just look closely. Do... do they seem familiar to you?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Familiar how?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just familiar. Have you seen them before?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox, I don't know what you want me to say. You know my memory isn't as good as it used to be, ever since I had the stroke, I just don't know...

speaker: MULDER
line: It's all right.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Oh, Fox...

speaker: MULDER
line: Dad never bought you a vacuum cleaner, did he?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Yeah. A long time ago. I don't use it anymore.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is it?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Well, it's here, under the stairs, in the storage. Fox, what is going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir? I've been denied further access to John Lee Roche. I've been told that order comes down from you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Could you tell me why you saw fit to strike a prisoner in federal custody? Agent Scully didn't report that to me, Mulder, though she should have. The whole thing was videotaped as per prison policy. I saw it. You're lucky I don't have your ass in a sling!

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir...

speaker: SKINNER
line: You gotten too close to this, Mulder. You've let this man get to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have reason to believe he can tell us what happened to my sister Samantha.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It is looking possible, sir. John Lee Roche apparently spent most of 1973 in Boston. He did take one sales trip up to Martha's Vineyard in October of that year. The timing is right.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to know. I just need to speak with him one more time, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It just makes it even less of a good idea, Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, the fact remains that we still have two more victims that we need to find and identify, and no one has more insight into Roche than Agent Mulder and this is still Agent Mulder's case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You tread very lightly. You see that he does.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I'm not talking to you if you're going to hit me again.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. You don't get to touch them. They stay in the bag. Name them.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I think you know one of them already.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Prove it.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Watergate was on TV. You and your sister... were sitting in front of it... playing a board game with, uh, little red and, uh... blue plastic pieces. And you wanted to watch a TV show... the one, the one with Bill Bixby? What the heck was the name of that thing?

speaker: MULDER
line: How could you know what I said?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I was watching... from the window. I was, I was very careful.

speaker: MULDER
line: If that's true, tell me where my sister is.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Pick her out.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You choose the one that was your sister, and I'll tell you where she is. Hey, come on, it's a fifty-fifty chance. Either way, I'm giving you a victim. That one? You're sure you want that one? No, just kidding, it's... it's a good choice. Okay, you want to write this down?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... let's get a team out here. Let somebody else do this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Help me, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not her, Scully. Am I right? Samantha broke her collarbone when she was six. It was her left collarbone. We had, we had a rope swing out in the backyard. It's not broken, is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're right, Mulder, it's not a match. It's not her.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's somebody, though.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You know, like I said...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: It was a fifty-fifty chance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tell us the name of that girl.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: It was Karen Ann Philiponte. She lived in a green rancher in... East Amherst, New York. Mint grew outside her window. I stood outside her window atop sprigs of mint. It smelled wonderful.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What year?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: July... 1974. I had her mother on the hook for an Electrovac Argosy, but at the last minute, she said "thanks but no thanks." Oh, well. It's your sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: If that's true, tell me where.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You want to know a lot more than that, don't you? You want to know everything, right? The big mystery revealed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Drop the mind games.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I can't just tell you. I know you don't believe me. You need me to show you, you need me to lead you through because... after all these years, anything less than that's not going to satisfy you, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: You just want to get out of here.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You're damn right I do... if only for a day or two. I'm realistic. And more than that, I... I can't wait to see your face.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God... You're going to see the inside of your cell instead. You're going to rot there. Are you okay? Mulder, the last thing you should do is give this man his way on this. If you do, he could string us along forever. I know you appreciate that. There has to be another way to come to the truth.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Clerk's office.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Special Agent Fox Mulder with the F.B.I.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Can I use the lavatory?

speaker: MULDER
line: Keep your hands in your lap.

speaker: STEWARDESS
line: Need a drink?

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: First flight?

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, I have to get by.

speaker: YOUNG MOTHER
line: Yeah.

speaker: STEWARDESS
line: Could you just wait one second, please?

speaker: MULDER
line: Now!

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You having fun?

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Mmm-hmmm.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: What's your name?

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Caitlin.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What the hell do you mean...

speaker: SKINNER
line: He checked out Roche?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder convinced the judge that it was an emergency situation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And where were you while this was happening?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I had left Agent Mulder for the day. I suggested that he get some sleep. Sir, I have a clear idea of where he might have gone and I am sure that I can catch up with him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll be the one to catch up with him. Where's he headed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Martha's Vineyard. And I would hope that you'd appreciate the uniqueness of this situation and it's effect on Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I fully understand the effect it has on him, Agent Scully. As I recall, that was the sum and total of my last words to you on the subject. You let me down. Let's clean up this mess before it gets completely out of hand.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: No one home? I sat on this couch... when your dad bought the vacuum. You're ready?

speaker: MULDER
line: Go.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: November twenty-seventh, 1973. I watched the house for hours. I parked across the way, out over there. I was just casing, I wasn't planning for this to be the night. But then, all of a sudden, your parents leave and I figure...

speaker: MULDER
line: Where'd they go?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: House next door. To play pinochle, I don't know... whatever it was people did back then.

speaker: MULDER
line: Go on.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: So after they're gone, I get out of my car and I move closer. And I watched you and your sister playing that board game. A little bit after eight, I'm about ready so I move to the junction box. I cut the power, and the lights go off, and then I moved around the front door. And I was ready to kick the door in... it was unlocked. It was 1973. It was... a different world back then.

speaker: MULDER
line: And then what did you do?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Well, you remember that. I... came in the front door. And you tried to get to your father's gun, I g, I give you credit for that. But then you sort of froze, and then... I took your sister away from all this. To a happier place.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's exactly how it happened? Right here in this room?

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wrong house. My father bought this house after he and my mother divorced. This house is in West Tisbury. The house that Samantha was abducted from is in Chilmark. That's six miles from here! You screwed up. You were never here. You didn't take Samantha.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Wishful thinking.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. No, but I think I know what happened. Somehow you got inside my dreams.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Come again?

speaker: MULDER
line: I profiled you. I got inside your head, maybe you got inside mine. Maybe some nexus or connection was formed between us and through that, you got access to my memories of my sister Samantha and you used them against me for this.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You're just resisting me.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you're in the wrong house, you stupid son of a bitch! You were never here, you liar!

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: It's geography, man. It's just geography. It was twenty-three years ago, that was geography we're talking about.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but you remember all the other details so vividly. That's because you watched it through my eyes... through my dreams.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I hear things about you, Mulder. You know what I heard? I heard you go after aliens... from space. It's like your world will be okay as long as you can believe in, like, flying saucers. But I'm telling you the God's honest truth. I can see you're not as open-minded as you think you are.

speaker: MULDER
line: You must have been one hell of a salesman, Roche. First flight's at six A.M. Why don't you enjoy your last few hours of freedom? Come on.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Fox! Fox, help! Unlock me! Help! Help me! Fox, help me! Help me! Unlock me! Fox! Fox, help me! Unlock me! Fox!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder, open the door!

speaker: MULDER
line: He must have done it in my sleep, I had another dream.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why don't you check to see if anybody saw him leave?

speaker: MULDER
line: He took the last cloth heart.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He also took your badge and your phone.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where's your gun? How do you explain yourself, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You don't. A predator is loose because of you. God only knows how many hours lead he's got. Any idea where he might be headed?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's your phone? There was a small child on the plane.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What child?

speaker: WOMAN ON PHONE
line: Seaboard Air...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, please put me through to your supervisor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what child?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Fox Mulder of the F.B.I. I'd like a passenger manifest last night. My badge number is J-T-T... An Agent Mulder just called ten minutes ago. They gave him the same information.

speaker: WOMAN
line: He said he was from the F.B.I. He said her mother was in an accident. He needed to take Caitlin...

speaker: LOCAL COP
line: You said he was a, a white male?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Yeah.

speaker: LOCAL COP
line: About how tall was he?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Um, he was about six foot five or something. He said his name was Mulder. He had a badge. He said he was official. Oh my God, what have I done?

speaker: LOCAL COP
line: We sent a unit over to pick up the girl's mother. She's on her way down.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Okay.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Wh, what am I going to tell her? It's all my fault.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not your fault. It's my fault. Sorry, Scully, you were right. He was playing me the whole time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't think he took Samantha?

speaker: MULDER
line: None of that really matters now, does it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, where do you think he'd take this girl? Would he follow his M.O. and drive her out of state?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's no reason for that, he knows we're going to catch him. He just needs it be sooner than later. He's going to stay in the Boston area. It'll be somewhere nearby.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, how much of a creature of habit is he? Do you think he'd want to take her someplace familiar?

speaker: MULDER
line: Try to relive some past glory? Is that what you're thinking? I don't know, what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he lived in Boston in the early '70s, right?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you got?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Roche's old address in the area. Revere. Nine-eight-o-nine Alice Road, apartment number six...

speaker: MULDER
line: He's there.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How do you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: Alice, "Alice in Wonderland," he's the Mad Hatter.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder, that's, that's...

speaker: MULDER
line: That's where he got the idea in the first place.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, let's go! <-9809 ALICE ROAD->

speaker: SKINNER
line: Check the other rooms!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think he brought her here.

speaker: MULDER
line: He never brought anyone here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Plug the entrance!

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I'm beginning to believe we do share that... nexus you spoke of. You always seem to find me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you okay, Caitlin? Good. My name is Fox, I'm going to take you home.

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I have your gun, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Caitlin, can you do me a favor? Can you count to twenty? Can you do that? Will you close your eyes and count to twenty out loud, quietly and slowly?

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS/MULDER
line: One, two...

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Three...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I will shoot.

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Four...

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't make this end badly.

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Five... Six... seven...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You're not giving me very much choice.

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Eight... Nine...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: I really don't want to go back to prison.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Put the gun down, Roche!

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Ten... eleven... twelve...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: You have one left.

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Thirteen...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: How are you going to find her without me?

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Fourteen... fifteen...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: How sure are you it's not Samantha?

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Sixteen...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: Huh?

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Seventeen...

speaker: JOHN LEE ROCHE
line: How do you know?

speaker: CAITLIN ROSS
line: Eighteen... nineteen...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get her out of here. Call an ambulance!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got back some lab results. The dye analysis determined that the fabric of the last heart was manufactured between 1969 and 1974... but beyond that, there's nothing more they can tell us. Mulder, it's not Samantha... and whoever that little girl really is, we'll find her.

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know... but I do know you. Why don't you go on home and get some sleep?
